node.title: Russian troops trying to seize Chernobyl nuclear plant, says Ukraine's president
node.description: "Our defenders are giving their lives so that the tragedy of 1986 will not be repeated," Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky tweeted.
node.content: ["Russian forces are attempting to seize the Chernobyl nuclear power plant, the site of the\u00a01986 nuclear disaster, according to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.\u00a0", "\"Russian occupation forces are trying to seize the #Chornobyl_NPP,\" Zelensky\u00a0tweeted\u00a0Thursday, hours after Russia began its invasion of Ukraine. \"Our defenders are giving their lives so that the tragedy of 1986 will not be repeated.\"", "Zelensky called it \"a declaration of war against the whole of Europe.\"", "The disaster in 1986 was the world's worst nuclear accident. An explosion and fires at the site \u2014 about 80 miles north of Ukraine's capital \u2014 sent radiation into the air, with large amounts carried over Belarus, Russia and Ukraine.\u00a0", "Scores of people were evacuated from the area following the meltdown, and at least 32 people died because of the blast and its immediate aftermath. Roughly 11,000 cases of thyroid cancer may be linked to the disaster, according to a 2016 report from the World Health Organization.\u00a0", "The plant has been decommissioned and a protective shelter covers the reactor to prevent radiation from leaking. The area around the reactor is off-limits to the public.  ", "The Associated Press contributed to this report."]
